meanings.definition: those who abolish or put an end to something
meanings.sent1: The abolishers fought for the rights of all people to be free.
meanings.sent2: The abolishers successfully ended the unfair law.
meanings.sent3: The abolishers threw a party to celebrate the end of the unjust rule.
meanings.sent4: The abolishers were like superheroes, saving the day for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The abolishers were determined to bring justice to the land.

meanings.definition: the act of abolishing or getting rid of something
meanings.sent1: The abolishers of the old law were praised for their courage.
meanings.sent2: The abolishers of slavery made a significant impact on history.
meanings.sent3: The abolishers of the outdated tradition did a happy dance.
meanings.sent4: The abolishers of ignorance shone a light on the truth.
meanings.sent5: The abolishers of darkness brought forth a new era of enlightenment.
